summary:
Work-In-Process, perfomance-hungry, soapy and sometimes eye-candy enb.
Nothing special.
descriptionHtml:
[size=3][center]
Just another useless ENB.

And... first of all, english is not my native language, so please excuse me for my stupid mistakes if there are any. Thank you.

So, a little info about this preset.[/center]
[center]-It's designed to be used with downsampling or good monitor. If you are a Nvidia user you can create custom resolution in Nvidia Conrol Panel, that is far more than yours native display resolutuion. For example i use 2560x1440 on a 1920x1080 monitor. If you have a couple of Titans you can try to set AddDisplaySuperSamplingResolutions=true, then select 3840x2160 in Skyrim launcher and enjoy ur 20 FPS in Whiterun.[/center]
[center]-It's designed to be used with complete setup of Skyrim Mod Combiner. If you are sufferinfg from freezes you can try to optimize textures with this tool: http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/12801/?, just use "resize > 2048", there is almost no visual qualty loss. Almost. Anyway, you will need about 4GB of VRAM.[/center]
[center]-It's WIP. This is not actually means that i will update it on a regular basis, i just got bored and decided to share my current ENB config with nexus community, but, well, i will work on it and really want to hear your advices and ideas.

-It's designed to be used with vanilla distant fog in exteriors. You should not install any mods like Revamped Exterior Fog.[/center] [/size]
[size=4][center][size=3]-This perset really sucks when used with Climates of Tamriel, Pure Weather, ELE or other weather mod. ELE Weathers for Dragonborn seems okay and i actually recommend it.[/size][/center][/size]
author: zoxxi
